                                                                    theorem MeasureTheory.OuterMeasure.toMeasure_zero {α : Type u_1} [inst : MeasurableSpace α] :
                                                                    MeasureTheory.OuterMeasure.toMeasure 0 (_ : inst ≤ MeasureTheory.OuterMeasure.caratheodory 0) = 0
                                                                    source
                                                                    def MeasureTheory.Measure.trim {α : Type u_1} {m : MeasurableSpace α} {m0 : MeasurableSpace α} (μ : MeasureTheory.Measure α) (hm : m ≤ m0) :
                                                                    MeasureTheory.Measure α

                                                                    Restriction of a measure to a sub-sigma algebra. It is common to see a measure μ on a measurable space structure m0 as being also a measure on any m ≤ m0. Since measures in mathlib have to be trimmed to the measurable space, μ itself cannot be a measure on m, hence the definition of μ.trim hm.

                                                                    This notion is related to OuterMeasure.trim, see the lemma toOuterMeasure_trim_eq_trim_toOuterMeasure.

                                                                    Equations
                                                                    • MeasureTheory.Measure.trim μ hm = MeasureTheory.OuterMeasure.toMeasure ↑μ (_ : m ≤ MeasureTheory.OuterMeasure.caratheodory ↑μ)
                                                                    Instances For
                                                                      source
                                                                      @[simp]
                                                                      theorem MeasureTheory.trim_eq_self {α : Type u_1} [inst : MeasurableSpace α] {μ : MeasureTheory.Measure α} :
                                                                      MeasureTheory.Measure.trim μ (_ : inst ≤ inst) = μ
                                                                      source
                                                                      theorem MeasureTheory.toOuterMeasure_trim_eq_trim_toOuterMeasure {α : Type u_1} {m : MeasurableSpace α} {m0 : MeasurableSpace α} (μ : MeasureTheory.Measure α) (hm : m ≤ m0) :
                                                                      ↑(MeasureTheory.Measure.trim μ hm) = MeasureTheory.OuterMeasure.trim ↑μ
                                                                      source

                                                                      theorem MeasureTheory.zero_trim {α : Type u_1} {m : MeasurableSpace α} {m0 : MeasurableSpace α} (hm : m ≤ m0) :
                                                                      MeasureTheory.Measure.trim 0 hm = 0

                                                                      theorem IsCompact.exists_open_superset_measure_lt_top' {α : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace α] [inst : MeasurableSpace α] {μ : MeasureTheory.Measure α} {s : Set α} (h : IsCompact s) (hμ : ∀ (x : α), x ∈ s → MeasureTheory.Measure.FiniteAtFilter μ (nhds x)) :
                                                                      ∃ U x, IsOpen U ∧ ↑↑μ U < ⊤

                                                                      If s is a compact set and μ is finite at 𝓝 x for every x ∈ s, then s admits an open superset of finite measure.

                                                                            theorem mem_map_indicator_ae_iff_mem_map_restrict_ae_of_zero_mem {α : Type u_2} {β : Type u_1} [inst : MeasurableSpace α] {μ : MeasureTheory.Measure α} {s : Set α} {f : α → β} [inst : Zero β] {t : Set β} (ht : 0 ∈ t) (hs : MeasurableSet s) :
                                                                            t ∈ Filter.map (Set.indicator s f) (MeasureTheory.Measure.ae μ) ↔ t ∈ Filter.map f (MeasureTheory.Measure.ae (MeasureTheory.Measure.restrict μ s))
                                                                            source
                                                                            theorem mem_map_indicator_ae_iff_of_zero_nmem {α : Type u_2} {β : Type u_1} [inst : MeasurableSpace α] {μ : MeasureTheory.Measure α} {s : Set α} {f : α → β} [inst : Zero β] {t : Set β} (ht : ¬0 ∈ t) :
                                                                            t ∈ Filter.map (Set.indicator s f) (MeasureTheory.Measure.ae μ) ↔ ↑↑μ ((f ⁻¹' t)ᶜ ∪ sᶜ) = 0
                                                                            source
                                                                            theorem map_restrict_ae_le_map_indicator_ae {α : Type u_2} {β : Type u_1} [inst : MeasurableSpace α] {μ : MeasureTheory.Measure α} {s : Set α} {f : α → β} [inst : Zero β] (hs : MeasurableSet s) :
                                                                            Filter.map f (MeasureTheory.Measure.ae (MeasureTheory.Measure.restrict μ s)) ≤ Filter.map (Set.indicator s f) (MeasureTheory.Measure.ae μ)

                                                                            theorem ae_eq_restrict_iff_indicator_ae_eq {α : Type u_1} {β : Type u_2} [inst : MeasurableSpace α] {μ : MeasureTheory.Measure α} {s : Set α} {f : α → β} [inst : Zero β] {g : α → β} (hs : MeasurableSet s) :
                                                                            f =ᶠ[MeasureTheory.Measure.ae (MeasureTheory.Measure.restrict μ s)] g ↔ Set.indicator s f =ᶠ[MeasureTheory.Measure.ae μ] Set.indicator s g
